numSides: A cylinder is approximated by a regular polyhedron of this number of sides

energy: The sign of the energy determines the direction of the electron along the beam ({{ appState.models.simulation.beamAxis }}) axis

triangulationLevel: Governs the max size of triangles used to subdivide the shape, from coarse to fine. Smaller triangles gain accuracy at the expense of longer solve times.

numTransPoints1: Number of Points in Gap Direction
numTransPoints2: Number of Points in Transverse Direction

cutAxis: Direction perpendicular to cross-section of interest
edge: Index of base shape edge to fillet, relative to the view axis
Index of base shape edge to bevel, relative to the view axis

cutAxis: Direction perpendicular to cross-section of interest
cutRemoval: Determines which side of the cut plane to remove

beamAxis: The beam will travel along this axis, used when exporting fields
coordinateSystem: Ordering of spatial variables. Use Standard for [x, y, z] or Beam for [width, height, length]
heightAxis: Height is measured along this axis. For undulators the gap is usually defined in this direction
widthAxis: Width is measured along this axis

gapOffset: Additional offset away from the beam along the height axis

phaseCount: The magnetization of each successive magnet is rotated by 2π/n about the beam direction

gapOffset: Additional offset of magnets away from the beam along the height axis
